intro: Campanula carpatica subsp. turbinata, commonly known as the Turban Bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It features showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from blue to purple, often with a white throat. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders. Its ornamental value is enhanced by its early summer blooming period and ability to naturalize in suitable conditions.
